events.comment: Constants for the Signal events. Change the value in the GAME_NAME immediately so that it wont conflict with anyone else sharing the same name.
Below are the global variables we use for the game screen.
If the game is paused or not.
Ready status to determine when the game starts.
Row cycle is used in the battle section of the project.
Selection is used to target the position of some card abilities.

event-group.description: Events triggering when the game layout is displayed.
event-group.title: On Start of Layout

sub-events.comment: Destroy unnecessary objects and rest all the game variables to the initial state.
Another on start event. When the game screen is launched, you will attempt to connect to the signal server
The "HintText" text object keeps the player updated on the different stages.
Sets every players alias to "player". Change this if you ever want the alias of players to be displayed,
Automatically joins up with another player looking for a game. The game locks when 2 players are ready.
When the connection to the signal server is made:
If you are the host then you are assigned your player variable and have the first turn.
If not, then you are set to player 2.
When 2 players have connected, the choice of deck to use is displayed.
Touching the "DeckSelector" object
Checks if the button is number 1, meaning it is the test deck.
When this button is pushed we quickly set up the tester deck. We use arrays to hold all the information for drawing new cards.
Setting up the test deck list: (explained in more detail in the "EditorEvents" event sheet).
Firstly, the Game deck is "pushed back" meaning a new column is created and the first value is set to the name of the Card.
Yvalue 1 = Type of card.
2 = Card Cost.
3 = Card Attack Value.
4 = Card Defence Value.
5 = Creature Buff 1.
6 = Creature Buff 2.
7 = Buff 1 modifier.
8 = Buff 2 Modifier.
Since we want 4 of the same card here it is repeated 4 times.
Every time a new card is added the "CardCount" local variable increases. When it reaches the deck limit we call the ready function, event: 50.
Number 2 for custom deck 1
Local variable used only in this group (folder) for counting the card count.
For the custom decks, the same event is repeated 50 times,

This event sets up the game deck card by card. The game deck copies all the cards that are in the custom decks, We always add all the cards to the "GameDeck" because the custom deck arrays are set up differently to be used in the editor.
If there isnt any cards left then remove the row.
Custom deck 2
The only difference with the above is that the values for the game deck are being drawn from the CustomDeck2 array.
Custom deck 3
After the game deck is created, the ready function is called.
The deck selection objects and text are destroyed.
Afterwards we send a message to the other peer to let them know we are ready.
Host messages are "Broadcasted"
Whereas the Peers messages are sent without an ID so it goes back to the host,
After this is done, we call the Start game function below.
When both players have sent ready messages the game starts.
Both players draw 5 cards. Change the repeat value to something different if you like.
Depending on whether you have first turn or not, the hint text will be updated.

action.name: Set text
action.param: "Play a Resource card to gain mana."

sub-events.comment: This event below means that you are not the host - meaning it will only be triggered for the peer.

event-group.description: Some miscellaneous events related to the games user interface.
event-group.title: UI

sub-events.comment: Pressing the menu button, returns you to the title screen.
When you leave you send a message to the other player to let them know.
Disconnects from the game room and signal server.
Used to sort the players hand. Whenever the Card is not active (meaning it is not being dragged) the card moves back to its X and Y value.
This event only targets the cards in your hand.
When a spell card is played, its active variable is set to 2 and the card flies onto the screen.
Sorts the enemy hand
Moves the card back
We use this function when the amount of cards in your hand changes. By calling this function all of the available cards on screen update their positioning values.
For each hand size, the X and Y value of the cards are set to different numbers.
From here you can easily change the numbers to suit different UI schemes.
Same as the above but for the enemies on screen cards.
When the "UpdateStats" function is called:
Both mana and life objects are updated to reflect current values.
If you have more mana than your mana total then it is deducted. Useful for cards that destroy resources.
After the health is updated, these 2 events below check that you and your enemy havent reached 0.

action.name: Set text
action.param: "You lose. Exit back to the menu when ready"

sub-events.comment: When a player reaches 0 health the game gets paused so you cant interact with it anymore.

action.name: Set text
action.param: "You win! Exit back to the menu when ready"

sub-events.comment: Triggered when an enemy loses a card.
This function triggers whenever an ability forces your opponent to discard.
First checks that your enemy has at least 1 card and if s, chooses a random card and destroys it.
When a card is destroyed, and cards that are numbered higher that the destroyed card reduce their value by 1. Used when you call the card spacing function below.
When your enemy gains a card.
Checks that the enemy doesnt already have the max amount of cards in hand.
When you lose a card without playing it.

event-group.description: Gameplay Functions used during the battle.
event-group.title: Game Functions

sub-events.comment: Whenever a player draws a card from the deck. The card from deck is chosen at random and the card is created and values populated from the column in the array. Afterwards that X element of the array is removed.
Sends the message to the other player to update their enemy card visual.

event-group.description: Card modifier functions attached to cards being played. When a card is played, they will call on these functions to affect the board.
event-group.title: Card Abilities

sub-events.comment: Gaining a card.
Repeats based on the function paramater. So if the function is called with a paramter of 2 attached then it will happen twice.
Waits 0.4*loopindex - this is a special kind of wait that must be used in repeat events if you dont want everything to happen at once.
If a creature has haste, then the exhausted card status is removed and the position of the card is set to ready so that the creature can attack the turn it is cast.
This is for single target spells that damage an enemy
This event makes sure that the card is targeting a creature card in the enemy area.
The damage is attached to the function. From there we set the "TargetDamage" variable to that parameter and apply it to the card.
we use the "Selection" variable to pick which row the card is in, and also that the card is not out your area (so it belongs to the enemy).
Afterwards we apply the damage taken to the text covering the card so you can see how much damage the card has taken that turn.
Sending the spell name, position and damage amount to the other player.
At the end of the function, we call the creature death function which covers removing creatures from play and resume the game by setting pause to 0.

This is for creatures that have a damage spell modifier on a single target. It is different from the above in the way that the targeting works. Instead of dragging the spell card over the target, after the creature is played the targetign system comes up.
If there is a card in enemy territory then it gets paused, if not then the targeting is skipped.
Sets the pause variable to 2 so that nothing can be done until a target is selected.
Any creature cards not in your area are highlighted.

action.name: Set text
action.param: "Select a target for the creature Ability."

sub-events.comment: When touching a creature that is highlighted, the damage is applied.
The spell card for returning a creature from the board to the controllers hand.
Picks the exact position that you have selected based on the functions parameter and resets the card position to the default values.
Destroys any card status attached.
Checks if the card is in your area (meaning the creature belongs to you).
Checks that your hand isnt already full and then creates the card to be put back into your hand.
All of the cards stats are sent via function parameters.
If the card is not ours then we update the enemy hand visual.
Just like the "Creature ability : Magic Damage" brings up the targeting system when the ability is attached to a creature card.

action.name: Set text
action.param: "Select a target for the creature Ability."

sub-events.comment: Calls the "ReturnCreature" spell function with all of the card variables attached as parameters to the function.
Destroys the card in the enemy territory after the function is sent.
Destroy an enemy creature.
Creature ability destroy enemy - brings up the targeting system

action.name: Set text
action.param: "Select a target for the creature Ability."

sub-events.comment: Gaining life function, the parameter value is added to your life total.
Afterwards we call the "UpdateStats" function to display the changes.
Subtracts the parameter value instead of adding it.
Used when your enemy gains life.
Send the message to call the Add cardback function
Gaining resources, Function parameter is added to your mana total.
If your enemy gains a resource this is the event to update the other players side.
Losing a resource.
If the total mana is less than 0 due to resources being destroyed it is automatically set to 0 instead,
If you are forced to discard from enemy card abilities.
Damage ability that targets all enemies. Damage is in the function paramater.
Picks all cards overlapping a card position in the enemy area.
Damage ability that targets all creatures on the board including your own. Damage is in the function paramater.
Card ability that destroys all creatures on the board.
Works by setting the damage to the defence value of the card.
Add your new card abilities here:
These are the card abilities that affect the player casting the card. From here we will send a message to the other client what has happened
Add your new card ability here
Add your new card ability here

After the battle phase has ended, or after damage has been dealt byt a spell, each creature is checked. If the 'damage taken' card variable is equal to or greater than the card defence, the card is destroyed.
Afterwards, resets the card position slot to the default value and sets the status of the buttons to ready so that the game can continue as normal.
Local variables to be used with the attack function.
Each time we call the battle function they are reset to 0.
When the battle function is called, this event checks whether it is your turn or the enemies. This is to decide if the attackers come from the top row or the bottom.
Picks all CardPosition slots.
If the position slot has a creature in it, it is in your area and the creature is ready to attack then the attacking variables are set and the card is temporarily popped up.
There is 5 card rows on the board, and this group of events repeats for each creature you have on the board. The RowCycle variable keeps track of which lane we are in.
If the creature is unopposed, subtract the attack value directly from the opponents life.
If there is an enemy creature in the lane, add the card damage to the "DamageTaken" value (enemy damage is calculated at the end of battle).
If there is an enemy in the lane, this event will add damage back to the attacker. disable this if you want only the defending creature to take damage.
These two event trigger the Row cycle mechanic.
This event checks that the CardPosition is equal to the RowCycle variable, that it is in your area and if there is no creature in it (signified by the filled=0 instance variable).
Since we check each row when attacking this can skip the delay if there is no creature in the lane.
Since we check each row when attacking this can skip the delay if there is no creature in the lane.
Battle called during enemies turn.
Pops the card down in the opposite direction.
If the creature is unopposed.
If there is an enemy creature in the lane.
Retaliation Damage.
The function to change which lane attacks.

First checks that the RowCycle value is less than or equal to 4. If it is equal to 5 (meaning all lanes have attacked) this event will not trigger. Each time we call this we add 1 to the variable so it counts up.
If Row cycle is equal to 5, set control of the buttons back to the player and trigger the CreatureDeath function to see if any creatures have recieved fatal damage.
These 2 functions are called after a peer message that the turn has ended. Sets the TurnText object to reflect the players turn, adds a hint message to keep the players informed.
Called when the host ends the turn.
At the end of the turn, picks all cards with the text object overlapping them (meaning they are creatures on the board) and resets their damage taken to 0 which means they are back at full health.
Disable this event to have damage on creature cards continue as the game plays on instead of being reset even turn.
If your hand is full when the turn ends, you lose a card to make space for the next draw.
If this event is called and the player is not the host then the card positions are reset to ready which enables the attack button to be used for the turn.
Called when the peer ends the turn.
Disable this event to have damage on creature cards continue as the game plays on instead of being reset even turn
If your hand is full when the turn ends, you lose a card to make space for the next draw.
Calls the Reset Phase function below which restores mana and allows the player to draw a card.
Targets only your mana object to be refreshed.
Player Draws a card.
Resets CardPositions to the ready value so that creatures can attack.
Sets buttons to the ready state and also destroys and CardStatus objects (which removes the exhausted state from previously summoned creatures.
Resource Increamenting is done here.

event-group.description: The events are only active when it is the players turn.
event-group.title: Active Player Events

sub-events.comment: All of these events below are only active when the PlayerTurn global variable is equal to their own turn AND that the pause value is equal to 0.
This way we can give the player more interaction only when it is their turn.
Ending the turn.
Touching the GameButton, checks the animation is set to the EndTurn animation.
When clicked sets the ready status to false so that it cant be clicked again until next turn.
changes the frame to give it the highlighted effect.
Sets the displayed mana of the opposite player to full.
Calls the end turn function.
We use 'Else' here so that if the above event is not true (meaning we are the peer not the host) we call the peer end turn function instead.
Finally after a short wait we reset the animation frame to default.
Initiating the attack function.
Compares the animation of the button to make sure it is the attack button.
Sets the row cycle variable to 1 so that battle is prepared to attack from the first lane onwards.
Sets the tap value on the gamebutton to 1 so that it cant be clicked more than once per turn.
This is for the card control.
When you touch a card that has a number greater than 0 (meaning it is in your hand and not on the board) the instance cariable on the card "Active" is set to 1 and it is moved to the top layer.
Depending on the type of card, a different hint will be displayed.

action.name: Set text
action.param: "Drag the Resource Card into the middle of the screen to play."

action.name: Set text
action.param: "Drag the Creature Card into a free slot to play."

action.name: Set text
action.param: "Drag the Spell Card onto an enemy Creature slot to play."

action.name: Set text
action.param: "Drag the Spell Card into the middle of the screen to play."

action.name: Set text
action.param: "Drag the Spell Card onto any Creature slot to play."

sub-events.comment: Every tick event: When the card is active, it is constantly set to the touch.X and Y of either the mouse cursor or your finger.
When the active card is touching the card position slots, depending on the type, different things will happen.
If you have a creature card and it is overlapping an empty space, the card highlight will be displayed.
If you have a spell that targets an enemy creature, sets the highlight value accordingly.
Cards that target any creature on the board.
Highlights are set invisble again if not interacting with a dragging card.
When playing cards, we temporarily use these local variables to help assign the values.
The way this works: This event will trigger at the end of any touch WHEN there is an active card on the board (meaning you have just been dragging a card).
If the card is a resource card, it compares the Y value was less than 460 when the card was let go.
Subtracts 1 from the HandSize global variable, which helps us set up the position of the cards in hand.
Adds one to current and total mana and triggers the resource player boolean to true (which means we cant play another resource this turn.
Send the info to the other player to be updated via the multiplayer message.
When a card is put down, we subtract 1 from every card that is numbered higher than the one that was played.
Creature card.
Checks that all conditions are ture : The card is overlapping a card position, that card position is empty and in your area and finally that you have the mana to cast it. Subtracts mana when cast.
Before we destroy the card being played we record all of its variables so it can be recreated on the field.

CardPosition creates the new card and sets up the variables from those above. Adds a text box and pins it to the card so damage can be shown. Sets Card Position to false so that another creature cant be cast on top of it.

After the card is created, we then check if it has any buffs. Buffs are on cast efects that affect the game. Whatever buff it may be, the name of it is called in the function by referencing the instance variable.
Wait 0.01 because we need to give the event sheet a second to catch up. We are going to be targeting all cards including this fresh card we just put down.
Call the second buff, if any.
Sends the relevant information to the other player so that they can create the card on their end.
The multiplayer message sent along with it is set up to be used with the tokenat expression. Basically it allows it to be broken down into the individual parts.
Spell Card that targets an enemy creature.
Checks that the card was overlapping an enemy creature.
Records the needed variables again.
When cast, the card sticks to the target for 1 second before being destroyed.

event-group.title: Multiplayer - Spell Card targeting an enemy

sub-events.comment: Send the info to the other player, type, position and card animation.
Spell Card that targets the opposing player.
Just checks that the card is not overlapping your card area tiled background object.

event-group.title: Multiplayer - Spell Cards targeting the player

sub-events.comment: Send the info to the other player, position and card animation
Check if there is enough mana and if so
Check if there is enough mana and if so
Type 5 is for cards that can target any creature, and that creature is to be removed from play without taking damage etc.
At the moment exclusively used for returning cards from the board to players hand.
Sets all of the temporary values to the spell card so it can be displayed on the enemies screen.
By picking the card that is not equal to Type:2 we make sure we target the spell card first.

event-group.title: Multiplayer - Spell Card targeting any creature

sub-events.comment: Send the info to the other player, position and card animation
By picking the card that IS equal to Type:2 we make sure we target the creature card second.
Setting all the creature card variables to the function message so the card can be recreated into your hand.
If your going to attach another ability to a return creature spell, it must go into the buff2 slot. Buff 1 slot is specifically used for the return creature spell in type 5 cards
At the end of the 'on any touch end' trigger, sets the cards active to 0 (which means if it wasnt destroyed it will slide back into position.

event-group.description: All of our peer to peer communication.
event-group.title: Peer to Peer Communication

sub-events.comment: Whenever a player does something that needs to be updated on the other players side. A multiplayer message is called.

Multiplayer messages can work the same way as function. When either the host or the peer gets a multiplayer message with the tag "Leave", the hint text is updated to let you know someone has left the game.
Used after the deck is selected at the beginning of the match.
Calls the enemy gain card function to add another enemy card.
Calls the enemy gain card function to add another enemy card.
Called when we want the other player to update the mana and health stats.
Called when the opposing player initiates the battle phase.

action.name: Set text
action.param: "Play a Resource card to gain mana."

action.name: Set text
action.param: "Play a Resource card to gain mana."

sub-events.comment: Called when the opposing player plays a card, whether it is a spell or a creature.
Breaks down the multiplayer message using the tokenat expression to set up the basic values to be set to the card.
After we have the values, we spawn the card and set them up.
If the card played is a resource we update the mana.
If the card played is a Spell card, then, based on the type different things will happen.
If it is a targeted spell then it is set to move on top of the card it was played on.
Set to the middle of the screen if it doesnt target a creature.
The return creature type.
If the card position is greater than 5, the it means the creature is in the enemy territory.
targets the cardposition that is equal to the global variable -5 (because we need to make the adjustment for the perspective on the game).
just in case the card has a status effect
If the card position is greater than 5, the it means the creature is in our territory.
Just in case the card has a status effect when bounced back to hand it is destroyed.
This section covers all of the Card buffs (or extra abilities that are attached to the cards being played).
Changes the life instance variable based on the number attached to the multiplayer message.
Updating anything that happens with resources.
Dicarding random cards for you and your opponent.
Wait 0.4*loopindex because the normal wait command doesnt work here.
Used for damage spells that affect creatures.
Adds the damage to the affected card.
Updates the cards text.
Used for spells that destroy creatures outright.
Sets the damage to the cards defence to ensure it is destroyed.
Waits a short period before the card is destroyed.
Used for spells that destroy ALL enemy creatures outright.
Targets each creature card in the enemy area.
Used for spells that apply damage to ALL creatures on the board.
Used for spells that destroys ALL creatures outright.
Local variables used to return creatures to hand.
If the selection variable is less than 6 then the card is returned to your hand.
checks the handsize is not already full before drawing the card.
Add your new card ability here
Add your new card ability here
Add your new card ability here
